revised_title: Geological History and Structure of the Northern Great Barrier Reef
tldr: This article discusses the geological history and structure of the northern Great Barrier Reef using high-resolution seismic profiling. The authors found a sequence of varied lithologies with major and minor disconformities in both reef and non-reef accumulations. They also discovered that the present viable outer reefs are remnants of more extensive precursors and that the area's geological history is marked by significant paleoenvironmental changes.
